title: Ownership, SLAs & Accountability: Who Is Responsible for the Agent
intent: Understand how to assign clear ownership and service expectations so agents can be operated like real systems, not experiments.

core_idea.one_liner: If nobody owns the agent, nobody is responsible for its mistakes.
why_it_matters: Agents affect real decisions and systems.

definition.agent_ownership: Explicit assignment of responsibility for an agent’s behavior, quality, and lifecycle.
definition.sla: Agreed expectations for availability, accuracy, latency, and escalation.

ownership_roles.responsibility: Defines agent scope, value, and success criteria.
Ensures reliability, observability, and cost control.

agent_sla_dimensions.example: Human handoff within 10 minutes for critical cases

incident_handling: Detect via metrics or user report
Identify agent version and knowledge set

micro_example.scenario: Agent gives wrong recommendation in production

response.follow_up: Update knowledge version and rerun evals

guards: Every agent must have named owners.

teach_it_in_english.simple_explanation: Agents need owners just like services do.
teach_it_in_english.one_sentence_definition: Ownership turns AI from a toy into a system.

practical_checklist: Who is on call for this agent?
